subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Licensing for Jerome and Ghoti fonts
msgSnippet: Change anything you want, however, I think it might be a good idea to rename altered forms--otherwise, the it s uniqueness as the first QS computer font will
messageBody:
Message
Change anything you want, however, I think it might be a good idea to rename altered forms--otherwise, the it's uniqueness as the first QS computer font will remain.  But others have already started bringing their creativity to bear. Also, altering a font once named and distributed would result in different looking-versions being on different computers, and it could get so no one would be sure what someone else's Jerome looked it...  That's why Times New Roman and Arial don't change.  Someone already has made a mercifully simplified version of Jerome called Junior, which doesn't imitate Senior QS.  It's far more practical for computers than the half-letters of Jerome with their unresolved spacing problems.
 
I'd like to see the Read community develop fonts with all the crazy variety and expressiveness of the Shavian community.  Have at it!
 
SylOm v'tOvy

Shalom v'Tovah,

Jon    
My Website URL: www.frimmin.com
*****************************************************
It is more necessary to love much than to think much;
always do that which impels you most to love.

        --St. Teresa of Avila, The Interior Castle

-----Original Message-----
From: Josh Cogliati [mailto:jjc@...]
Sent: Friday, August 02, 2002 9:27 AM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Licensing for Jerome and Ghoti fonts

On Thu, Aug 01, 2002 at 08:24:48PM -0400, Jon Zuck wrote:
> Relax, my friend.  I created Jerome as a gift to the Shavian community.
> Enjoy!
> / JerOm z f  Yl !
Can changes be made to the font (if so does it need to be renamed?) and can
versions in different formats be created?


--
Josh Cogliati
jjc@...

Change anything you want, however, I think it might be a good idea to
rename altered forms--otherwise, the it's uniqueness as the first QS
computer font will remain.  But others have already started bringing
their creativity to bear. Also, altering a font once named and
distributed would result in different looking-versions being on
different computers, and it could get so no one would be sure what
someone else's Jerome looked it...  That's why Times New Roman and Arial
don't change.  Someone already has made a mercifully simplified version
of Jerome called Junior, which doesn't imitate Senior QS.  It's far more
practical for computers than the half-letters of Jerome with their
unresolved spacing problems.
 
I'd like to see the Read community develop fonts with all the crazy
variety and expressiveness of the Shavian community.  Have at it!
 
SylOm v'tOvy

Shalom v'Tovah,

Jon    
My Website URL: www.frimmin.com
*****************************************************
It is more necessary to love much than to think much;
always do that which impels you most to love.

        --St. Teresa of Avila, The Interior Castle

> Enjoy!
> / JerOm z f  Yl !
Can changes be made to the font (if so does it need to be renamed?) and
can 
versions in different formats be created?


-- 
Josh Cogliati
jjc@...
